an10.118:1.1: “Mendicants, I will teach you the near shore and the far shore.
an10.118:1.2: Listen and apply your mind well, I will speak.”
an10.118:2.1: “And what, mendicants, is the near shore? What is the far shore?
an10.118:2.2: Wrong view is the near shore, and right view is the far shore. …
an10.118:2.3: Wrong freedom is the near shore, and right freedom is the far shore.
an10.118:2.4: This is the near shore, and this is the far shore.
an10.118:3.2: who cross to the far shore.
an10.118:4.1: When the teaching is well explained,
an10.118:4.3: are the ones who will cross over
an10.118:4.4: Death’s domain so hard to pass.
an10.118:5.2: an astute person should develop the bright.
an10.118:5.4: for the seclusion so hard to enjoy,
an10.118:6.1: you should try to find delight there,
an10.118:6.3: With no possessions, an astute person
an10.118:6.4: should cleanse themselves of mental corruptions.
an10.118:7.1: And those whose minds are rightly developed
an10.118:7.6: they are extinguished in this world.”
